question.questionA: Petals fused into a tube about as long as the lobes of the corolla.
question.questionB: Petals free or slightly fused at base.

question.questionA: Cauline  leaves  absent;  raceme occupying more than half the stem, unbranched.
question.questionB: Cauline leaves numerous; raceme occupying less than half the stem, often with short branches.

question.questionA: Plants forming rosettes; petals six to eighteen.
question.questionB: Plants not forming rosettes; petals usually four to five.

question.questionA: Small annuals; flowers inconspicuous; stamens as many as petals.
question.questionB: Annuals or perennials; flowers conspicuous; stamens twice as many as petals.

question.questionA: Minute, moss-like glabrous annuals; flowers sessile, axillary.
question.questionB: Small glabrous annual, 2-6 cm; flowers on pedicels, axillary.

question.questionA: Leaves  linear,  curved  upwards;  flowers  in  dense  flat-topped inflorescences  on scapes more than four times the depth of the inflorescence; petals narrowly spathulate.
question.questionB: Leaves  cylindrical, fleshy, glandular pubescent; scape less than the depth of the inflorescence or absent; petals ovate, acute.
Flowers in very compact, almost sessile, terminal cymes.
